interface.name: org.allseen.LSF.ControllerService.SceneElement
interface.description: This interface is provided by the LSF Controller Service to enable the LSF Controller Clients to create, update, delete, lookup and apply Scene Elements on Lamps.

method.name: GetAllSceneElementIDs
method.description: This method allows the LSF Controller Clients to fetch all the Scene Element IDs.

method.name: GetSceneElementName
method.description: This method allows the LSF Controller Clients to fetch the name of a Scene Element specified by the sceneElementID.

method.name: SetSceneElementName
method.description: This method allows the LSF Controller Clients to set the name of a Scene Element specified by the sceneElementID.

method.name: CreateSceneElement
method.description: This method allows the LSF Controller Clients to create a Scene Element.

method.name: UpdateSceneElement
method.description: This method allows the LSF Controller Clients to update a Scene Element.

method.name: DeleteSceneElement
method.description: This method allows the LSF Controller Clients to delete a Scene Element.

method.name: GetSceneElement
method.description: This method allows the LSF Controller Clients to fetch a Scene Element.

method.name: ApplySceneElement
method.description: This method allows the LSF Controller Clients to apply a Scene Element.

signal.name: SceneElementsNameChanged
signal.description: The SceneElementsNameChanged signal is used to notify the list of the Scene Element IDs whose names have changed.

signal.name: SceneElementsCreated
signal.description: The SceneElementsCreated signal is used to notify the list of the Scene Element IDs that have been created.

signal.name: SceneElementsUpdated
signal.description: The SceneElementsCreated signal is used to notify the list of the Scene Element IDs that have been updated.

signal.name: SceneElementsDeleted
signal.description: The SceneElementsDeleted signal is used to notify the list of the Scene Element IDs that have been deleted.

signal.name: SceneElementsApplied
signal.description: The SceneElementsApplied signal is used to notify the list of the Scene Element IDs that have been applied.
